title: Senior FP&A Manager
content:
About GelatoGelato has built the world's largest and most global platform for on-demand production and fulfillment of customized products. Today, those products are part of huge markets, such as apparel, wall-art, drinkware, digitally printed books, greeting cards. In the future, the market opportunities are endless thanks to new technologies such as 3D printing. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs and the global shift towards local and more sustainable production.
We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 100 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.Gelato is growing rapidly and is well capitalized. We are seeking a top-performing, analytically-driven person to join the Strategic Finance team. This role gives you a platform to accelerate strategic, financial, and commercial acumen, while driving Gelato’s financial performance.
Working closely with the General Manager North America, Divisional Director of Finance B2B, the Chief Financial Officer, and other members of the Finance team and Gelato’s leadership team, you will contribute to crafting the strategic agenda and the financial plan for the business, and driving their execution across all the functions.
What you'll be doingYou will work cross functionally to provide visibility on financial performance, create breakthrough analytical insights, participate in strategic and commercial projects, contribute to pricing decisions, and assess investment opportunities that accelerate our growth in North America and globally.


Be a business partner to our B2B commercial and network operating teams to accelerate growth and drive P&L optimization.


Establish robust budgets, forecasts, and follow-up processes with the quality and rigor required of a publicly listed company.


Build financial and operational models to enable strategic decision-making.


Develop and present insightful recommendations to senior management that lead to action.


Provide timely and accurate information for management reporting to generate insightful business analysis.


Support preparation of high-quality materials for investor meetings and Board meetings.


Support execution of projects related to strategy, M&A, partnerships, market expansion, and investment decisions.


Optimize pricing models towards customers. Benchmark competitor landscape and analyze internal data to assist in price change recommendations.


Working on multiple projects at a fast pace is business as usual. The ideal candidate is a curious problem solver who wants to exceed expectations, is eager to learn and improve.
 
Who you areYou are a leader and committed to ensuring we deliver operational excellence. You are a passionate defender of the customer experience. You are ambitious, self-directed, and driven. You are extremely data-driven. You are an excellent communicator, equally confident in talking to partners and colleagues. The ideal candidate will have:


A degree in economics, finance, business, math or engineering, with a strong academic performance from a top tier university. MBA from a top-leading institution and/or a professional Finance qualification (e.g., CPA, CIMA, ACA, ACCA) are a plus.


6+ years of relevant work experience, 3+ years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, Commercial Finance, or FP&A. Previous experience working with technology (software) companies is a plus.


Self-starter skills; someone who takes ownership of goals and works to meet or exceed them. Experience delivering projects from start to finish.


Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Strong attention to detail and zero-defect. A true ninja in Excel and Powerpoint.


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, able to build strong partnerships in cross-functional set-ups.


Fluent understanding of P&L dynamics and unit economics.


These are the early days. Come join us, and help us re-imagining the distribution of creativity. Be part of redefining the way people and companies communicate.
What it’s like to work at GelatoWe expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 
RequirementsAll candidates must have the legal right to work in the USA and will be expected to provide documentation to support this status. Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.What it’s like to work at GelatoWe are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit.
